main event: On August 2, 1955, a weather observer in Fresno, California, spotted a bright silver circular object moving across the theodolite field of view while observing a weather balloon.
interesting points: The object was brighter than the white balloon used for weather observation., The object moved at a steady rate of speed, faster than the balloon., Observations suggested the object was significantly higher than the balloon., The apparent diameter of the object was estimated to be a quarter to a fifth that of the five-foot balloon., Calculations suggested speeds of 80-130 knots if at 40,000 feet, or 120-200 knots if at 6,000 feet.
witness description: a weather observer from the Weather Bureau at Fresno
